thread.title: Important tips for surviving Calgary’s cold - Video - CityNews Calgary
thread.title_full: Important tips for surviving Calgary’s cold - Video - CityNews Calgary

title: Important tips for surviving Calgary’s cold - Video - CityNews Calgary
text: Calgary The latest updates and breaking news, now available around the clock. Check back in with us at any time to find out what's happening, and always be the first to know. CityNews, Everywhere. A unique Afro-Brazilian drumming samba class is being offered in Calgary. 4h ago The purpose of having mock-tails is not to alienate those who want to drink but to ensure that those who don’t or can’t drink feel welcome and supported. With an extreme cold warning still in effect for the city, there are some important things Calgarians need to know. 5h ago Calgary is under an extreme cold warning; Danina Falkenberg finds out how some newcomers to Canada are handling the cold snap. WestJet says they cancelled 122 flights Saturday. That’s on top of the 100 that were cancelled Friday. Alberta’s electric system continues to meet power demand across the province, despite the extreme cold. Silvia Naranjo reports. The extreme cold has caused the cancellation of almost 200 WestJet flights across the prairies over the past two days. Callers to the CityNews660 traffic centre indicated the cold weather was impacting gas pumps across Calgary on Friday. On the coldest day of the year in Calgary, CTrain users experienced broken down and delayed trains, cancelled buses and a lot more. Henna Saeed reports on the woes of the stranded passengers. Justin Bennett confessed to undercover police officers that he had snapped when the child interrupted his video game, smashed her head and threw her against a wall. Calgary Police confirmed the incident happened around 10:30 Friday night, leading to the closure of a section of Westwinds Drive Northeast. The Government says extreme cold resulting in high power demand has put the province’s electricity grid at high risk of outages. China has failed to sway a pivotal election in Taiwan after warning for months the outcome of the vote would be a choice between “war and peace.” Caryn Ceolin with the geopolitical implications of William Lai’s victory. 11h ago
